Hi all,

I experience the same problem on Linux, with Matlab 7.2.0.283 (R20=
06a)
and the current CVS version of cantera. 

Does anybody know a way how =
to use the the function Mixture in Matlab?

Thank you,
Sebastian

Here's my=
 code and the error message:

gas1 =3D Water;
gas2=3DGRI30;
mix =3D Mixture=
({gas1, 1.0; gas2, 0.1})

--- In cantera@=
yahoogroups.com, "Dave Goodwin" <dgoodwin@...> wrote:
>
> All I can think o=
f is that this may be an incompatibility between
how MATLAB Cantera MEX 
> =
file is compiled and how MATLAB itself is compiled.  I would
recommend buil=
ding Cantera 
> from source code using Visual C++ .NET with the development=
 version
(CVS) of Cantera 
> and see if this fixes the problem.  Or just wa=
it a day or so until
Cantera 1.7.0 is released, 
> which I have verified to=
 work with MATLAB under Windows at least on
my system. 
> 
> For what it's =
worth, Python seems to be less susceptible to such
errors than MATLAB.  
> =

> Dave
> 
>
